title: Water cannons will be used, says police source.

replies.msg:
SCMP 2019-08-25 3.40pm

Water cannon could be used today

A police source says senior officers have agreed to use water cannons on protesters today if the situation deteriorates, the Post has learnt.

“The cannons are on standby position at the moment and are ready for deployment if needed,” the source says.

Heavy rain continues to fall in Hong Kong, and the bad weather might cause difficulties to the usual crowd control measures, including the use of tear gas, if demonstrations turn ugly.

Earlier, the Post reported that three anti-riot vehicles armed with water cannons had been going through road tests and could be ready to handle unrest by mid-August if they passed.

Designed for crowd control and costing a total of HK$16.59 million (US$2.12 million), the Mercedes-Benz vehicles arrived in the city in May last year and have since been stationed at the Police Tactical Unit headquarters in Fanling for training.
